course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Liaozhai and Story Creation
course.description: Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio, or Liaozhai Zhiyi, is the most outstanding short story collection in classical Chinese literature. Crafted by Pu Songling (1640-1715) during the Kangxi period of the Qing Dynasty, this book contains more than 500 stories and depicts an array of characters in the society, such as court officials, civilians, intellectuals, merchants, peasants, pawns, and labours. It tells various stories about fox fairies, ghosts, gods from heaven in spatial settings including city and village, earth and ocean, the human world and the hell. Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio also brings a rich touch of humanities in plurality and diversity. Accordingly, this course intends to evoke students' imaginability as well as creativity in novel creation through analyses on Pu Songling's Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio and investigations on the contemporary Chinese short stories and traditional Chinese literary cannons.

reviews.author: chen1202
reviews.comment_content: 总体来说，这门课workload非常少，很轻松，而且老师上课不仅讲小说，也讲个人经历，挺有趣的，但也很热门，选课要抢。
reviews.comment_teaching:
阎老师的课堂基本上是前半段讲聊斋，后半段让同学提问。如果对小说和文学很有兴趣，那这个课就是一个可以与大咖交流的很棒的机会，因为他可以对你的小说创作提供指导。
除此之外，这门课有时候用讲座替代正课，是老师和别的嘉宾的对话，挺有意思的。
reviews.comment_grading: 看个人造化了，毕竟是creative writing
reviews.comment_workload: 很少，一学期就只要写两篇短篇小说，平时的reading也都是看中文小说。
